definition: to concentrate on trivial points while neglecting the main problem (idiom)
small/tiny/few/young
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

covertly/secretly

Confucius says:
(literary) (final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 呢[ne5] or 啊[a1])
differing only slightly/not much between them
stupid/foolish
Knowledge is not innate to man, how can we overcome doubt?/We are not born with knowledge, how does one achieve maturity? (i.e. without guidance from a teacher - Tang dynasty essayist Han Yu 韓愈|韩愈)
pinyin: ren2 fei1 sheng1 er2 zhi1 zhi1 zhe3 , shu2 neng2 wu2 huo4
related.word: 人非生而知之者，孰能无惑

definition: don't let rhetoric spoil the message (idiom); don't get carried away with flowery speech to the detriment of what you want to say
form word/in Classical Chinese, the first character of phrase having auxiliary grammatical function
beginning-school ceremony (old usage)/classical learning
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
mixed-up and superfluous
Zai Yu sleeps by day (idiom); refers to story in Analects of Confucius remonstrating bitterly with his student for sleeping during lectures
see 一之為甚|一之为甚[yi1 zhi1 wei2 shen4]
